message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with privacy concerns in index coding, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The use of limited-access schemes involves designing and analyzing coding matrices, which can be seen as a problem in linear algebra and combinatorics (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the performance of different coding schemes, which can be evaluated using simulations and numerical analysis (cs.SI). Finally, the concept of privacy in communication networks is a topic that falls under the category of network and internet architecture (cs.NI).
